channel.title: How to make stop running?
channel.description:
BEFORE:
If Right was pressed the Character would get a velocity to the right and the running Animation will be activated. If The Key Was released the Characters Velocity will be set to 0 and the Running Animation will become a Standing Animation.
NOW : if(Right_Pressed == true) moveRight();
The program checks if the Right Button was Pressed. If So call the moveRight methis which gives the character a Velocity and enables the Running Animation.
Problem : How can I efficiently do what Key Released used to do in this way ? Which is Set the Velocity to 0 and the Animation to Ssanding when the Right Button is not being Pressed.

item.title: How to make stop running?
item.dc:creator: @BAsh BAsh
item.description:
@BAsh wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:16, topic:231656”][quote author=chrisn2323 link=topic=305135.msg2445832#msg2445832 date=1221709461]

i need it to be cleaner than just doing it like

if(Right_Pressed == true)
moveRight();
else {
if(Right_Pressed == false)
stopMoving();

They the hell hell hasn’t anyone flamed the crap out of: if (aBoolean == true) ???

cuz it is just a preference.
[/quote]

Driving down the freeway in reverse is a preference as well, that doesn’t make it right.

But on a serious note, it’s not like it’s terrible or anything, when it’s all said and done and converted into bytecode it’s effectively the same, it’s just easier to read if you leave off the ‘== true’ if all you’re doing is a conditional on a boolean.[/quote]
You have no fucking idea do you? Not only is that bit redundant it makes you look retarded. If you ever understood what an if() statement actually did you would not be using this syntax and it is fucking stupid.

Read full topic

stopMoving();

They the hell hell hasn’t anyone flamed the crap out of: if (aBoolean == true) ???

cuz it is just a preference.

Driving down the freeway in reverse is a preference as well, that doesn’t make it right.

But on a serious note, it’s not like it’s terrible or anything, when it’s all said and done and converted into bytecode it’s effectively the same, it’s just easier to read if you leave off the ‘== true’ if all you’re doing is a conditional on a boolean.[/quote]
well its not as serious as driving backwards. I guess for some people == true is easier to read.

item.title: How to make stop running?
item.dc:creator: @moparscape4lifez moparscape4lifez
item.description:
@moparscape4lifez wrote:

oh well then slowly decrease the number don’t change it right away to 0 but put the code in a game loop not in the button code add a timer of some kind into it

Use doubles and decrease it by 0.1 or 0.01 (slower)


	
		if(Up_Pressed || Right_Pressed || Down_Pressed || 
		   Left_Pressed || S_Pressed || S_Pressed || D_Pressed){
		
		if(Up_Pressed) goUp();
		if(Right_Pressed) moveRight();
		if(Down_Pressed) goDown();
		if(Left_Pressed) moveLeft();
		if(S_Pressed) Jump();
		if(A_Pressed  Dash();
		if(D_Pressed) shootBuster();
		
	} else {
             while(1)
               {
	                  if(whateverVelocity > 0)
			whatevervelocity--;
                               doMoveWithNewSpeed();
                              Thread.sleep(10);
               }
 TheGoods.MasterGX.changeAnimation(Standing);
}

if UpdateDMastaGX() is already called in a loop then u dont need that while(1) and Thread.sleep it would just work

Read full topic

item.title: How to make stop running?
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

i’ll show u what i did…

[code]
public void UpdateDMastaGX(long elapsedTime){

	super.UpdatePlayer(elapsedTime);
	
	if(Up_Pressed || Right_Pressed || Down_Pressed || 
	   Left_Pressed || S_Pressed || S_Pressed || D_Pressed == true){
	
	if(Up_Pressed == true) goUp();
	if(Right_Pressed == true) moveRight();
	if(Down_Pressed == true) goDown();
	if(Left_Pressed == true) moveLeft();
	if(S_Pressed == true) Jump();
	if(A_Pressed == true) Dash();
	if(D_Pressed == true) shootBuster();
	
}
	else TheGoods.MasterGX.changeAnimation(Standing);

}[/code]

Read full topic
